content:
#74679 requests that methods defined on raw slice pointers should be callable from raw array pointers. This currently fails because raw slice pointers are not treated as supertypes of raw array pointers by the type system. @RalfJ wants this coercion to work for ergonomic reasons.

Would it be ok to coerce coercable raw pointer types when we check for candidates in method::probe, should we only output an error suggestion here or is there some other way to do this more elegantly besides coercions in method::probe?
